Mr, Grantham said he appeared for Mr, Dew to ask
his lordship to assess the amount of compensation to
which he was entitled under the 121st section of the
Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, in consequence of the
railway companies taking possession of his premises for
purposes connected with the railway. When tho in-
terest of a tenant was only from year to year the com-
pensation had to bo assessed by a magistrate. The case
was 5 simplo onc, but had been productive of a great
deal of litigation. The details of the caso having been

-gonsinto, the Lord Mayor fixed the total amount of
the compensation due to Mr. Dow at £698 4s, 1d. Mr,
Grautham then applied for costs, and the Lord Mayor
granted twenty guineas costs,
